origin_of_ch_char_book: The first born son had a privilege as the inheritor of the parentsâ€™ family fortune. In return, the oldest son was responsible for the ceremonies of ancestors and parents. With such privilege, the eldest son had power over his younger siblings. Therefore, the eldest son often ordered his younger siblings around. (å…„, xiong=hsiung, elder brother) describes elder brother, which combines a (å£, kou, mouse) and a person (äºº, ren, human). Together, they symbolize â€œa person who speaks or gives ordersâ€. If the spirit tablet or altar (ç¤º, shi=shih, show) is added to the left , (ç¥, zhu, wish), it means the eldest brother who represents the group praying or calling a blessing from God. Then, how can the younger brother be depicted? The creator(s) of Hanzi thought about the sequence of brothers. The character (å¼Ÿ, di, younger brother) shows a spear in the middle (æˆˆ), and a rope winding the spear (). The reason for winding the spear is to prevent slippage and to make sure the spear will not break. This character came to mean â€œyounger brotherâ€ because of the meaning of winding order, or sequence. When you wind a rope around the spear, you have to do it in an orderly way. Therefore, it symbolizes the order in the ages of the siblings.,When enemies are far enough away, soldiers attack with arrows, but when the distance is shorter, they use spears. (æ­¦, wu, military) is a combination of a spear (æˆˆ) and a foot . It implies a person running with his spear.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The character image is equipped with a long-handled Ge shape. " Ge " is an ancient sword weapon. Later, Yu Ge increased the spearhead and became a halberd. See " halberd ".

Because of the difficulty of writing oracle bone inscriptions, straighter lines are used to express " Ge ", with a lower level of pictogram. The character " Ge " in the bronze inscriptions of the Shang dynasty has a relatively high level of pictograms. Bronze inscriptions and ancient seals are made from the " ge " of " gold " to emphasize that they are cast by metal.

"Shuowen": "Ge, flat head ğ¢§¢ also. From Yi, one horizontal. Pictogram. All the belongings of Van Ge are from Ge." Zhu Junsheng, "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng": "Yi, Shuya, six feet long Six inches. Its blade is horizontal and can be attacked. It is different from a spear that specializes in stabs and stabs. It is also different from a halberd and a stab." Press " Tiao ", which is the long handle of Ge. "Zhou Li. Winter official test work record. "Yeshi": "Ge Guang Sancun, Neibeizhi, Hu Sanzhi, and Yuan Sizhi." According to Ge's blade, it is called " Yuan ", and the place where the end of the Yuan turns down is called " Hu ", embedded in the wooden handle and The opposite end of the aid is called " inner ", and the small hole that can be used to put the Pivet rope is called " through ".

Oracle is used as the original meaning, referring to Ge. "Collection" 29783: "Its ğ¢¦šGe Yi, Axe Nine." " ğ¢¦š " means to offer. Also used as the name of Fang's country, "Collection" 8397: "Ling (mand) Ge Fang."

Bronze writing is also used as the original meaning, referring to Ge. Small minister's house: "Bai (Bo) gave the small minister's house painted shield and Ge Jiu", which means that Bo Mao's father gave the painted shield and nine Ge rewards to the small minister's house. Chengyang Xincheng Lige: "Chengyang Xin (New) Cheng Lige", Chengyang Xincheng is the place name. Also used as a name or clan name.

The " Ge " in the bamboo slips of the Warring States period extended to refer to force. "Guodian Chu Jian. "The Tao of Tang Yu" Jane 13: "Xia uses Ge, Zheng (conquer) but not prepared (Serves)", referring to Xia's use of force to conquer the unconvinced.

The currency " Ge " is used as the name of an ancient country, "Zuo Zhuan. "The Four Years of Xianggong": "Every place is overwhelming, and every place is over Ge." Du's note: "Guo and Ge are both ancient country names. There is a Guoxiang in the north of Donglaiye County. Ge is between Song and Zheng." "Tongzhi. The Second Clan": "Ge clan, the country of the princes of Xia Shi, Shaokang destroyed it. The land is between Song and Zheng. The descendants regard the country as the clan."

" Ge " in the handed down documents means war from weapons, "The Book of Later Han. "Gongsun Shuzhuan": "Yan Wuxige, humbly serves the Han", which means to stop the war and serve the Han Dynasty with humble words.

origin_of_ch_char_book: The first born son had a privilege as the inheritor of the parentsâ€™ family fortune. In return, the oldest son was responsible for the ceremonies of ancestors and parents. With such privilege, the eldest son had power over his younger siblings. Therefore, the eldest son often ordered his younger siblings around. (å…„, xiong=hsiung, elder brother) describes elder brother, which combines a (å£, kou, mouse) and a person (äºº, ren, human). Together, they symbolize â€œa person who speaks or gives ordersâ€. If the spirit tablet or altar (ç¤º, shi=shih, show) is added to the left , (ç¥, zhu, wish), it means the eldest brother who represents the group praying or calling a blessing from God. Then, how can the younger brother be depicted? The creator(s) of Hanzi thought about the sequence of brothers. The character (å¼Ÿ, di, younger brother) shows a spear in the middle (æˆˆ), and a rope winding the spear (). The reason for winding the spear is to prevent slippage and to make sure the spear will not break. This character came to mean â€œyounger brotherâ€ because of the meaning of winding order, or sequence. When you wind a rope around the spear, you have to do it in an orderly way. Therefore, it symbolizes the order in the ages of the siblings.,When enemies are far enough away, soldiers attack with arrows, but when the distance is shorter, they use spears. (æ­¦, wu, military) is a combination of a spear (æˆˆ) and a foot . It implies a person running with his spear.
